'''Hröangolmë''' or the "lore of the body" was one of the matters most studied by the [[Númenóreans]], concerning the arts of healing. Númenóreans had a self-healing power superior to the [[Men]] in [[Middle-earth]], and sickness was rare among them until the decay of the isle. However, they had learned much of this lore from the [[Eldar]] and they found practical to keep a continued study of medicine in case sickness appeared. Thus, in their first travels to Middle-earth, Númenóreans were most welcomed by native Men, as they shared their knowledge of these skills.<ref>{{NM|P3xi}}, p. 322, cf. footnote</ref>

==Etymology==
''Hröangolmë'' is clearly [[Quenya]], from ''[[hröa]]'' ("body") + ''[[ñolmë]]'' ("lore, knowledge").
